Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 08:19PM tmetz1616 wrote: Hi JosieKat, I have felt that way soooo many times throughout treatment.  Maybe not as much with the stage 2 sisters, but definitely with the stage 0 and stage 1 gals.  I know cancer is cancer, but breast cancer is much much scarier when your diagnosed with stage 3.  I just finished chemo Dec 8 and Jan 20 I have chosen to have a bi-lateral mastectomy with immediate reconstruction with implants.  No TEs for me... yay!!  Anyhow, don't feel guilty, there's a reason this forum is for Stage 3 women.  Only we understand what being diagnosed with advanced breast cancer feels like.  It is an emotional rollar coaster to say the least and an extra long at that. Stay strong thru your journey and chemo will be over before you know it.  I don't know if you are set to take weekly taxol, but here is the good news if you do:  you'll likely find your hair starting to grow back right around week 6 of 12.  Mine did and 1 month post chemo my hair is already an inch long :))
Posts.Title: Why am I only ok talking to stage III ladies?feeling like a jerk Josiekat lkc

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2012 08:14PM tmetz1616 wrote: I had neo-adjuvent treatment.  4 rounds of A/C then 12 weekly Taxol completed 12/8/11.  I just had my BMX Jan 20 and I am starting rads in a couple weeks.  If you have any questions, feel free to send me a message. Good luck with your treatment :)
Posts.Title: Anyone else doing TAC neoadjuvant chemotherapy lisa224 GeorgiaRai

Posts.Content: May 22, 2012 10:46PM tmetz1616 wrote: thank you very much.. I appreciate all of your replies.  I just feel like I want quality of life at this point.  I am 31..  when I was taking tamoxifen, my bones ached all the time, my joints hurt every morning I woke up and during the night I constantly was awakened with severe leg cramps.  I felt like I was 80, not a 31 year old woman.  It's so hard for me to try taking this pill again knowing how horrible it made me feel.  Emotionally recovering is hard enough and right now I finally feel good physically again, I don't want that to go away.  To me, I feel like if cancer is coming back, it will, regardless of tamoxifen or not.  Maybe that sounds crazy, but I'm sick of thinking about cancer... and every time I take that pill, it reminds me.  There has got to be other methods.. Thank you for sharing the info on DIM mclark55 :)
Posts.Title: Anyone out there decline taking Tamoxifen? tmetz1616 shelly56

Posts.Content: tmetz1616 wrote: I finished Chemo 12/8 and rads 4/16 and life is finally good again.  I feel great and I look great.  I have some very serious concerns about Tamoxifen.  I took it for about 6 weeks and was miserable, so I stopped and within a week I felt so much better.  Is there any other Stage III sisters out there who declined Tamoxifen?  If so, are you using any other alternative, holistic treatments.   Please advise..  I've posted on here before and for some reason nobody seems to want to reply to my topics!!! Dx 6/13/2011, IDC, Stage IIIB, 3/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2012 09:22PM tmetz1616 wrote: I'm a 30 y/o who finished 12 weekly taxol on Dec 8 with very few side effects AND my hair started to grow back around week 6 :)  I've heard the DD taxol every two weeks is harder on your body and the side effects are worse, but of course everyone is different.
